sen.j: 下毛野国造（しもみつけぬのくにのみやつこ・しもつけぬこくぞう・しもつけののくにのみやつこ・しもつけのこくぞう)は下野国を支配した国造。
sen.e: Shimotsukenunokuninomiyatsuko (also known as Shimotsukenukokuzo, Shimotsukenonokunimomiyatsuko, and Shimotsukenokokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko ruled Shimotsuke Province.

Shimotsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko (also known as Shimotsukenukokuzo, Shimotsukeno no kunimomiyatsuko, and Shimotsukenokokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: 表記変更local ruling families in ancient Japan を追加しました。
sen.e: Shimotsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko (also known as Shimotsukenukokuzo, Shimotsukeno no kunimomiyatsuko, and Shimotsukenokokuzo) was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled Shimotsuke Province.

sen.j: もと毛野国造で、仁徳朝～孝徳朝に上毛野国造と分裂した。
sen.e: This post was originally Kenunokuninomiyatsuko, which was divided into Kamitsukenunokuninomiyatsuko and Shimotsukenunokuninomiyatsuko during the period from the reign of Emperor Nintoku to the reign of Emperor Kotoku.

This post was originally Kenu no kuninomiyatsuko, which was divided into Kamitsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko and Shimotsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko during the period from the reign of Emperor Nintoku to the reign of Emperor Kotoku.

This post was originally Kenu no kuninomiyatsuko, which was divided into Kamitsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko and Shimotsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko during the period from the reign of Emperor Nintoku to the reign of Emperor Kotoku.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』によると、崇神天皇の皇子豊城入彦が東国統治を命じられ、上毛野国造や下毛野国造などの祖先になったという。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki", Toyokiiruhikonomikoto, who was a Prince of Emperor Sujin and ordered to rule Togoku, was the ancestor of Kamitsukenunokuninomiyatsuko and Shimotsukenunokuninomiyatsuko.

According to "Nihonshoki," Toyokiiruhiko no mikoto, who was a Prince of Emperor Sujin and ordered to rule Togoku, was the ancestor of Kamitsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko and Shimotsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko.
sen.cmt: カンマの位置を調整表記変更
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki," Toyokiiruhiko no mikoto, who was a Prince of Emperor Sujin and ordered to rule Togoku, was the ancestor of Kamitsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko and Shimotsukenu no kuninomiyatsuko.

sen.j: また、その孫の彦狭嶋王が景行朝に東山道十五国都督に任じられ、その子御諸別王も引き続き、善政を行ったという。
sen.e: It is said that Hikosashimanomiko, a grandson of Toyokiiruhikonomikoto, was appointed Tosando Jugokoku Totoku during the reign of Emperor Keiko, and his son Mimorowakenokimi succeeded him and governed well.

It is said that Hikosashima no miko, a grandson of Toyokiiruhiko no mikoto, was appointed Tosando Jugokoku Totoku during the reign of Emperor Keiko, and his son Mimorowake no kimi succeeded him and governed well.

It is said that Hikosashima no miko, a grandson of Toyokiiruhiko no mikoto, was appointed Tosando Jugokoku Totoku during the reign of Emperor Keiko, and his son Mimorowake no kimi succeeded him and governed well.

sen.j: 『旧事本紀』によると、仁徳朝に豊城入彦命の４世孫の奈良別が下毛国造に任じられたという。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki", Narawake, the fourth descendant from Toyokiiruhikonomikoto, was appointed Shimotsukenokuninomiyatsuko.
According to "Nihonshoki," Narawake, the fourth descendant from Toyokiiruhiko no mikoto, was appointed Shimotsuke no kunimiyatsuko.
sen.cmt: カンマの位置を調整表記変更
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki," Narawake, the fourth descendant from Toyokiiruhiko no mikoto, was appointed Shimotsuke no kunimiyatsuko.

sen.j: 下野氏。
sen.e: The Shimotsuke clan.
The Shimotsuke clan.
The Shimotsuke clan.

sen.j: 姓は君。
sen.e: Kabane was Kimi.
Kabane was Kimi.
Kabane was Kimi.

sen.j: 天武天皇13年(684年)に朝臣を賜った。
sen.e: The clan was conferred on Asomi in 684, the 13th year of the reign of Emperor Tenmu.
The clan was conferred on Asomi in 684, the 13th year of the reign of Emperor Tenmu.
The clan was conferred on Asomi in 684, the 13th year of the reign of Emperor Tenmu.

sen.j: 延暦2年(783年)には降伏した蝦夷に下毛野姓が与えられた。
sen.e: In 783, the family name 'Shimotsukenu' was given to the surrendered Emishi.
sen.cmt: 「下毛野姓」の「姓」はカバネではなく苗字の意味に解釈して訳しました。
sen.e: In 783, the family name 'Shimotsukenu' was given to the surrendered Emishi.
In 783, the family name 'Shimotsukenu' was given to the surrendered Emishi.

sen.j: 下野国。
sen.e: Shimotsuke no Kuni.
Shimotsuke no Kuni.
Shimotsuke no Kuni.

sen.j: 現在の栃木県。
sen.e: Present Tochigi Prefecture.

sen.j: 祭神は二荒山神。

sen.e: The enshrined deities are Futarayama no ookami.

sen.j: 下毛野古麻呂 ...... 飛鳥時代の官人。
sen.e: SHIMOTSUKENU no Komaro: A government official during the Asuka period.
SHIMOTSUKENU no Komaro: A government official during the Asuka period.
SHIMOTSUKENU no Komaro: A government official during the Asuka period.

He compiled the TaihoRitsuryo code with Osakabe no miko, FUJIWARA no Fuhito, and AWATA no Mahito.
